inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getFirewall.

tags.description: Map of resource tags to associate with the resource. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getFirewall.

deleteProtection.description: Boolean flag indicating whether it is possible to delete the firewall.

encryptionConfigurations.description: AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS) encryption settings for the firewall.

firewallPolicyArn.description: ARN of the VPC Firewall policy.

firewallPolicyChangeProtection.description: A boolean flag indicating whether it is possible to change the associated firewall policy.

firewallStatuses.description: Nested list of information about the current status of the firewall.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

subnetChangeProtection.description: A boolean flag indicating whether it is possible to change the associated subnet(s).

subnetMappings.description: Set of configuration blocks describing the public subnets. Each subnet must belong to a different Availability Zone in the VPC. AWS Network Firewall creates a firewall endpoint in each subnet.

tags.description: Map of resource tags to associate with the resource. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

updateToken.description: String token used when updating a firewall.

vpcId.description: Unique identifier of the VPC where AWS Network Firewall should create the firewall.
